intro: Moehringia intricata, commonly known as the mountain mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats. The plant features delicate, hairy leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. It is part of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms. Moehringia intricata is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and is often found in meadows and open slopes.
